result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

3:32 PM Prosecuting attorney Jedidiah J Dodge appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Irma G Paredes Ruiz appeared by video, Attorney Richard E. Bender for Irma G Paredes Ruiz appeared by video. 

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 

BY THE COURT:  On the defendant's waiver of the preliminary hearing, the court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 
Bond continued. 

Atty Bender enters NOT GUILTY plea.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 31, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Letter from Atty Bender requesting permission to appear by Zoom. Forwarded to Judicial Assistant in Branch 2.
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing and Order to Bind Over filed by Atty Richard Bender
Preliminary hearing on March 21, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

01:19 PM Defendant Irma G Paredes Ruiz in court. Attorney (Atty)  Richard E. Bender appeared by video for Defendant Irma G Paredes Ruiz. 
Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kelly A Cassidy appeared for State of Wisconsin.  

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
filed by Atty Richard Bender

records.addlTxt: Atty Richard Bender appointed
Initial Appearance set for February 28, 2022 @ 1:15 p.m. in Br 1
Hearing on February 28, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
No in-person contact. Third party contact allowed.

01:05 PM Assistant District Attorney Jedidiah Dodge (ADA) appears in court.  
Defendant Irma Paredes appears from jail by video. 
Attorney (Atty) Maxwell Bergner appears in court for defendant. 

ADA Dodge states facts for anticipated charges of Felony Bail Jumping, Misdemeanor Battery, Disorderly Conduct, and Resisting an Officer.
Court questions Atty Dodge.
Atty Dodge responds.
Atty Bergner does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court states findings for the record.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Court questions defendant. 

Court questions the State about rights of victims rights notification.
State has followed victim rights notification.

State requests a $250 cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Bergner is requesting a signature bond and indicates objection to bond condition regarding contact. 

Court questions if the victim is requesting to make a statement today.

01:15 PM L.L. makes a statement for the Court.
Court questions L.L. regarding where victim and defendant are residing.
L.L. makes further statements. 

BY THE COURT: $150 cash bond ordered.

Initial Appearance scheduled for: February 28th, 2022 01:15 PM  in Branch 1.

Ms. Paredes questions the Court.
Court responds.
